title: 'Lives are being ruined by scams' claims charity
text:
Older people in Wales do not receive enough protection from scams, according to charity Age Cymru.
It's now calling on MPs in Westminster and AMs in Wales as well as the private sector to do more to protect people from attacks through the post, telephone, online and on their doorsteps.
Credit: PA Relying on awareness raising among vulnerable people is simply not enough.
"Up to £10bn is being lost to scammers every year and the problem is growing.
– Gerry Keighley, Age Cymru It wants direct mail companies to stop sending out misleading prize promotions that cheat vulnerable people into thinking they have won large sums of money and telephony companies to provide call blocking equipment to older and vulnerable people.
The charity also calls on police and enforcement authorities to standardise recording of scam fraud to show the scale of the problem and to work harder to reduce the stigma of being scammed and support victims more.
The Welsh Government says it has no powers to legislate on this issue.
Financial scams and consumer protection are not devolved matters. As such Welsh Ministers have no executive powers to enforce Cold Caller Zones and there is limited scope for us to legislate in this area.
“However we recognise the importance of this issue. We have provided funding to local authorities in the past for work relating to No Cold Caller Zones.”
– Welsh Government spokesperson Last updated Thu 17 Sep 2015 Money Wales
